content.text: Several users discussed AI agent capabilities and security. @elizaOS tweeted that "Plugins aren't tools. They're how agents extend themselves" and later added "It is not only social media management. It is what agent behavior looks like." @shawmakesmagic contributed to this conversation by explaining their role system for agents, noting that "agents are aware of who is their boss, and actions are validated against the role before being available to the agent." They further elaborated that in their system called The Org, permissions work similar to Unix admin controls, where natural language can extend role grants, and agents must check system permissions before performing actions, preventing them from being tricked or hallucinating capabilities.

@dankvr shared a detailed workflow for creating 3D characters: "1. Find an image / describe a character, ask chatgpt: 'can you make a t-pose transparent background front facing character art of this character.' 2. image-to-3D (TripoSG, Rodin, etc) 3. Rig via https://readyplayer.me/avatar-api." They mentioned creating approximately 40 characters in a few days using this method. In follow-up tweets, @dankvr noted that while the generated models need cleaning, they work with Mixamo, and suggested several tools for processing them including "gltf-transform / https://gltf.report / rapidpipeline / blender / needle cloud."

@dankvr advocated for Linux adoption, stating: "Linux is not difficult to install / use your daily / can breathe new life into your old computer. A lot has changed in the last ~4 years. Nowadays everything works out of the box and most issues can be troubleshooted quickly via LLMs + terminal."

@shawmakesmagic discussed challenges in crypto gaming, rhetorically asking someone "How many crypto games did you buy and play this year. Exactly." They elaborated on this issue by sharing: "My friends made a pretty incredible MOBA game but because it's crypto they can't get distribution and because crypto DGAF games unless it's the hype meta they are dropping the crypto and shipping a normal game." In another tweet, they posed the question: "People unsure of what the intersection of AI x Crypto is, why do you think Sam Altman created Worldcoin?"
When someone apparently asked about 3D modeling, @shawmakesmagic advised: "Don't even bother trying until you've made a donut," referring to a popular Blender tutorial.

Several tweets contained miscellaneous shares without extensive context. @dankvr shared an image in response to a conversation with @MikeBenzCyber and @JoshuaSteinman. @elizaOS tweeted "$DOOD" with no additional context. @shawmakesmagic mentioned "Elizafy" and announced "v2 Chill and Build (space)" and asked "Should we watch Solo Leveling and build The System?" They also shared an image that apparently resembled their profile picture, leading to some confusion with followers who didn't recognize it.
@dankvr shared content related to SAFE, asking "@iamgingertrash speaking of SAFE, did u see this?" with an attached image. They also shared a link in response to users @keshsad and @0xMert_.

Recent completed items in the ElizaOS repository include several features, bugfixes, refactors, and documentation updates. Feature additions include model usage event emissions for embeddings and image description in the OpenAI plugin (#4438), a new blog for Twitter agent setup (#4425), and docstrings added to the 'refactor-env' component (#4446).

Several bugfixes were implemented, including repairs to plugin.routes functionality (#4415), correction of CLI version detection to show the proper latest version (#4435), title spacing fixes in documentation (#4443), and ESM type generation fixes in SQL, Bootstrap, and OpenAI packages (#4442).

Refactoring efforts included enhancing the ElizaOS publish CLI command (#4424) and refactoring environment variable handling (#4445). Other maintenance work involved updating CLI command documentation (#4448) and organizing imports with relative paths (#4447).

Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository:

1. PR #4445: A refactoring of environment variable handling by wtfsayo.

2. PR #4448: An update to CLI command documentation by wtfsayo.

3. PR #3911: A feature implementation for local autodoc functionality by jmikedupont2.

4. PR #4442: A fix for ESM type generation in multiple packages (SQL, Bootstrap, and OpenAI) by michavie.

5. PR #4441: Typo corrections throughout the codebase by rnkrtt.

6. PR #4443: A documentation fix addressing title spacing issues by Dangoz.

Three issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza repository. Issue #4181 reports that Twitter interactions are being fetched but reactions have not been implemented yet. Issue #4180 indicates that Twitter space functionality is not working. Issue #4440 reports a TypeScript error where the property 'preconnect' is missing in a type definition.

GitHub activity for elizaos/eliza repository:

May 4-5, 2025: 5 new PRs were opened with 11 PRs merged. The repository had 11 active contributors and no new issues were reported.

May 3-4, 2025: 3 new PRs were opened with none merged. There was 1 new issue, and 6 active contributors were working on the repository.

The sources provide information about the top contributors for the GitHub repository elizaOS/eliza. However, both sources appear to be identical and contain only the heading 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' without listing the actual contributors.
